title: [Geyser Flats, Columnar Basalt]
description: The trail stops at the foot of a ridge formed of columnar basalt.  Rectangular fingers of stone reach up toward the sky like square tubes of a primitive pipe organ, their dark surfaces tinged in places with bright sienna.  Crevices in the stone make climbing the ridge possible, however easier trails lead off in other directions.

The trail stops at the foot of a ridge formed of columnar basalt.  Rectangular fingers of stone reach up toward the night sky like square tubes of a primitive pipe organ, their dark surfaces tinged in places with bright sienna.  Crevices in the stone make climbing the ridge possible, however easier trails lead off in other directions.
